result.execSummary:
The defendant Matthew K Springmeyer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • False Imprisonment, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.30.
  • 4th Degree Sexual Assault, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(3m).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Restitution payable to Danielle K for $7,197.78 and Crime Victim Compensation for $406.37 or civil judgment with tax intercept.  Bail to be applied if applicable.  Payable first during probation/extended supervision and that explicitly includes payment before DOC supervision fees.

Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges, and supervision fees or CIVIL JUDGMENT will be entered.
Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs. 

The Court ordered that all court costs, fees, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
Maintain employment and/or school and/or vocational training.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

Sex offender assessment and follow through with recommended programming.
Use a physician disclosure form.

Court IMPOSE and STAY the reporting requirements under 301.45 for the sex offender registry with DOC.  Case to be brought before the court to request requirement be imposed.

Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment.
Maintain absolute sobriety.  No drugs.  No alcohol.
Random urine screens and breathalyzer test.

timeConds.notes: Court order 180 hours of community service at a non-profit organization.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent.  Huber for work. No electronic monitoring. Credit for 5 days time.   served.
*12/14/2015  Honorable Ellen R. Brostrom- probation term commuted to two (2) years on count two.

DOC request to clarify length of probation term on count two.
Received and filed, letter from Tracy C.  lms
DNA COLLECTION

Defendant Matthew K Springmeyer in court with attorney James E Goldmann.  Kevin Shomin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.

Statements made as to sentencing.  Additional statements by: Danielle K.
COUNT 1 - CONCURRENT:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 5 YEARS, with credit for 5 days time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 2 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 3 YEARS.  The defendant IS NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program (Boot Camp) and IS NOT eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.  COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 3 YEARS.

COUNT 2 - CONCURRENT:
Defendant sentenced to serve 9 MONTHS in the House of Correction with credit for 5 days time served.  Huber privileges for work.   No electronic monitoring.   COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 3 YEARS.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION/PROBATION:
* Sex offender assessment and follow through with recommended programming.
* Use a physician disclosure form.
* Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment
   and successfully complete recommended treatment.
* Maintain absolute sobriety.  No drugs.  No alcohol.
* Random urine screens and breathalyzer test.
* Court order 180 hours of community service at a non-profit organization.
* Maintain employment and/or school and/or vocational training.
* Restitution payable to Danielle K for $7,197.78 and Crime Victim Compensation for $406.37 or civil judgment with tax intercept.  Bail to be applied if applicable.  Payable first during probation/extended supervision and that explicitly includes payment before DOC supervision fees.
* Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges,
   and supervision fees or CIVIL JUDGMENT will be entered.

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.  Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  

The Court ordered that all court costs, fees, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

Court IMPOSE and STAY the reporting requirements under 301.45 for the sex offender registry with DOC.  Case to be brought before the court to request requirement be imposed.

jad

On motion of the State, Court ordered presentence investigation. Order for presentence investigation filed; copy to Probation Dept.  
Case adjourned to 9-16-2015 at 8:30 a.m. for Sentencing Hearing in Branch 6.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may not possess any firearms and body armor.
Court advised defendant that he may not vote until civil rights are restored.
All parties are notified that effective August  3, 2015 this case will be assigned to Judge Ellen Brostrom, Branch 6,  in Room 423 of the Safety Building.  Any right of substitution begins to run as of the date of receipt of this notice, unless notified by the court on an earlier date.

AS TO BOTH CHARGES IN AMENDED COMPLAINT:
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Amended Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.

Defendant Matthew K Springmeyer in court with attorney James E Goldmann.  Michael Christopher Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Filed, original amended information; copy served on defendant.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of information, waives formal reading.
On motion of the State, Court ordered charge amended to:
-Count 1: False Imprisonent, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 940.30, 939.50(3)(h), a Class H Felony;
-Count 2: Fourth Degree Sexual Assault, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 940.225(3m), 939.51(3)(e), a Class A Misdemeanor.
  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 16, 2015 at 08:30 am.
